title: Sheffield Park Walks

images.title: Peter Trimming / Lake at Sheffield Park
images.caption: An almost perfect summer's day lends blue colour to the lake, whilst Sheffield Park House can be seen in the distance.

images.title: Paul Gillett / Footbridge between the lakes, Sheffield Park
images.caption: Footbridge between the lakes. Between Middle Lake and Ten Foot Pond (partially visible on the right).

images.title: Colin Smith / Sheffield Park House
images.caption: Sheffield Park House. Large mansion, in Gothic style, on the northern edge of the park.

images.title: Oast House Archive / Cricket field at Sheffield Park
images.caption: Cricket field in the park.

images.title: Ben Brooksbank / Former LSWR (Southampton Docks) 0-4-0T at Sheffield Park, Bluebell Railway 1992
images.caption: Former LSWR (Southampton Docks) 0-4-0T at Sheffield Park, Bluebell Railway 1992. No. 96 'Normandy' was built at Nine Elms Works in 11/1893. It spent its life until 1947 at Southampton Docks, then at Eastleigh for shunting at Winchester, becoming BR No. 30096 and was withdrawn in 10/63.

images.title: Peter Trimming / Giant Redwood, Sheffield Park
images.caption: Giant Redwood

description: Explore the beautiful Sheffield Park and Gardens on this circular walk near Haywards Heath in Sussex. The gardens were laid out in the 18th century by 'Capability' Brown with four delightful lakes as the centrepiece. There are also a number of peaceful woodland paths and South Park - 265 acres of wide open spaces. The Sussex Ouse Valley Way long distance trail passes the park so you could pick this up to extend your walk. The lovely waterside walk follows the River Ouse from its source near Lower Beeding to the coast at Seaford Bay. Just to the south east of the park you will find Chailey Common where there's nice footpaths, pretty heather and lots of wildlife to look out for. Newick and Fletching Common can also be found in this area.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just a couple of miles to the north there's more nice trails to try around Sheffield Forest. The peaceful woods are a great place for wildlife with Crossbill, Nightjar, Hobbies and Buzzards to see. You also could pick up the Uckfield Walk and explore the nearby Ashdown Forest for more woodland trails. For more walking ideas in the area see the Sussex Walks and High Weald Walks pages.

display_address: Sheffield Park Gardens Car Park, Aucklandii Walk, Fletching, Sheffield Park, Wealden, East Sussex, England, TN22 3QZ, United Kingdom
